But from the context given, there's no direct information linking religious beliefs to being judgmental in a jury setting. So putting it all together, even though the context doesn't explicitly state why the Buddhist was deemed judgmental, the answer is inferred from the selection outcome. Therefore, the Buddhist person was considered judgmental.
